title: Fix buttons :focus state styles
body:
Small change which fix two issues:

#### 1] Buttons :hover and :focus state shares styles now.
As you expect and as it is in BS3, `:focus` state is same as `:hover` state only extended by outline.

**Before:** `.btn` with `:focus` appears as normal button state with 'outline':
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/143115/50343520-7bc6cb80-0527-11e9-823f-4befa3bb1008.png)
**After:** `.btn` with `:focus` looks like `:hover` state with 'outline':
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/143115/50343553-a31d9880-0527-11e9-9649-00f4103c6982.png)

#### 2] Buttons :focus text color on 'a.btn' is now consistent with others '.btn'.
If you somewhere define specific color (e.g. `$danger`) for `:focus` state on `<a>` then ...

**Before:** This specific color is presented in `:focus` state on `.btn` made from `<a>`:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/143115/50343760-7027d480-0528-11e9-8846-8ee19a84aaf2.png)
**After:** Specific color is overridden with right `.btn` color:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/143115/50343799-9483b100-0528-11e9-960d-54965789984a.png)

title: Fix incorrect responsive alignment of dropdown menu
body:
It is incorrect to define left and right within separate `@media`.

The following demo shows incorrect alignment. The dropdown menu should be right aligned when large screen.

demo: https://codepen.io/anon/pen/WLGjGz

To fix the priority problem, it must be defined at the same breakpoint like a text utility.

https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/blob/12c4d3c248b49f1730c75fcf8fbcb4a97274ccf6/scss/utilities/_text.scss#L18-L26

body:

title: allow spacing utilities to override more easily
Coding conventions documentation
body:
A lot of (junior) developers use Bootstrap as starting point for front end development, but we don't reference to guidelines like http://codeguide.co/ in our docs where they can find out the best practices for HTML & (s)css. 

Maybe there are also other interesting sites we can refer to?

title: Disabled radio buttons do not indicate selection
body:
A disabled radio button group does not indicate the (pre)selcted value as other form fields do. I am not sure if this is intended behavior, but native radio buttons do show their state when disabled.

- Browser and version: Firefox 63.0.3, Chromium 71

title: Support control/label sizing for custom radios and checkboxes/switches
body:
Currently it is not possible to (properly) size custom radios and checkboxes, as one can do with other form-controls.

One can add `.col-form-label-sm` or `.col-form-label-lg` to the custom checkbox/radio markup to scale the label accordingly, but the indicator icon does not scale with the change in label font size.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2781561/49677219-ff76b780-fa53-11e8-97ad-88fbf094e54b.png)

One could switch the units of the `::before` and `::after` `width/height/top`, and the left gutter `padding` to `em` units instead of `rem` units (as these pseudo elements inherit the base font-size from their parent element - the label).  This makes the indicators scale nicely when the font-size of the label scales, without needing additional CSS rules for the indicators.  All that would be needed would be new classes `.custom-control-sm` and `.custom-control-lg` (as an alternative to using `.col-form-label-sm` and `.col-form-label-lg`) to control the font-size (and possibly top/bottom padding of the label text)

Example (switching pseudo element units to `em`):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2781561/49677209-eb32ba80-fa53-11e8-8d37-70289016897c.png)

title: Make `.close` hover focus styles less specific
body:
This pull removes the `&:not(:disabled):not(.disabled)` selector on the `.close` component and styles `:disabled`/`.disabled` directly because the `:not` pseudo classes are too hard to overwrite (breaks for people that extended `.close` based on the old version).

Also added variables:
```
$close-opacity
$close-hover-color
$close-hover-opacity
$close-disabled-opacity
```

Fixes #27784

title: Bootstrap 4.1.2 `.close` hover focus styles are too specific
body:
https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/commit/4f1bb98587411d6db16783ea116ff6d5d8f8fa49 from 4.1.2 moved hover focus styles on the `.close` component into `&:not(:disabled):not(.disabled)` making it too specific. This breaks hover focus states for those that extended the close component from previous versions.

https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/commit/eb5d0b49dc7439fa1cc3d0c41406eef00de149c1 makes it a little better, but the problem is still there.

title: A comprehensive reference guide to all functionality is required...
body: ...and needs to be made easily accessible. I can't believe there is not such a document anywhere on the internet. Do people have to waste time figuring it all out?

title: Scrollable modal
body:
This feature is inspired by [MDC Dialog](https://material-components.github.io/material-components-web-catalog/#/component/dialog).

Scrollable modal allows scrolling a modal body. Normally, model heights fit to their content, but scrollable modal make the height to fit within the screen when their content is too large.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4065765/49484938-38f4ca80-f87c-11e8-8809-59b4b9f1c548.png)

demo: https://deploy-preview-27769--twbs-bootstrap4.netlify.com/docs/4.1/components/modal/#scrolling-long-content

Cheers!

title: Vertical alignment of radio/checkbox broken
body:
Bug reports must include:

- Operating system and version: Windows 10
- Browser and version: Chrome 70
- Reduced testcase: https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.0/components/forms/#default-stacked

Even in the default theme it is visible that the radio/checkbox controls are slightly located upwards compared to the label text. It becomes more apparent if you use a custom theme.

title: Changing theme-color map not changing for hover
body:
Not sure how to best explain.

I'm compiling the custom.scss with a new theme-color map (among other changes) eg. 
```
$theme-colors: (
"primary ":#ead1dc,
"secondary ":rgb(111, 168, 220),
"success ":rgb(75, 191, 115),
"danger ":rgb(153, 0, 0),
"warning ":rgb(240, 173, 78),
"info ":rgb(31, 155, 207)
);

```

While the color correctly changes all buttons, alert, navbar etc, hovering over a button or selecting a checkbox option is still the default color and hasn't been updated.

I'm setting the variable first then importing the bootstrap scss files.

Any pointers or help would be much appreciated. Thanks!

I'm just wondering what's the community's take on this.

title: Print problems with d-print-none
body:
Operating system: Windows 10 x64
Browser: Chrome 70
Bootstrap version: 4.1.3

Hi,

I'm having problems printing when I use d-print-none to hide a div.

As you can see in the first photo, without the d-print-none the page break is correct in the table:

![01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4532871/48725635-0cf70980-ec2d-11e8-9d28-2439331f39c0.PNG)

But when I add the d-print-none, the page break does do badly. Shows a blank line (with grey color in the picture), as if it were the page break, but then continues with more lines and when it jumps to the second page the same line divides it between the two pages.

![02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4532871/48725637-0cf70980-ec2d-11e8-866c-4fe2807d8da1.PNG)

I do not know if I'm doing something wrong or I'm missing something.

And how can I print the background of a striped table? Even activating in chrome to print the background graphics does not print. DIV backgound print ok, but not those of the tables.

Thanks

title: Add new Horizontal List Group class.
body:
Hi  

**:rocket: Preview:** https://deploy-preview-27683--twbs-bootstrap4.netlify.com/docs/4.2/components/list-group/#horizontal-list-group

Back in September I opened a new feature request about adding a **new horizontal list group class** to the existing list group (see: https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/issues/27291) as I felt that although this could be done with pure utility classes it was difficult to get the border radius to match up.

Here, I am opening a new PR containing **my first attempt/implementation** at adding a few new classes in addition to the existing `.list-group` class which **shouldn't** contain any breaking change, but rather extend the current classes.

**Here's a breakdown of the initial changes that this PR contains (open to additional contributors):**

- [x] Add new `.list-group-horizontal` modifier class.
- [x] Add new `.list-group-horizontal-responsive` class for dealing with responsive horizontal list groups _(this also works with the existing `-sm|-md|-lg|-xl` variants)_
- [x] Add support for the `.list-group-flush` class to horizontal list group.
- [x] Update List Group docs with the new **Horizontal List Group** and **Responsive** variant.
- [x] Test with existing modifier classes such as: `.active`, `.disabled` and with `<a>` elements.
- [x] Add new border-radius mixins to support the new classes.
- [x] Utilise as many existing variables and primary extend only.
